<Link id="l00463" /><CodeLine lineNumber="463"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Emit the following sequence, using R4 as a temporary, since we cannot use</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00466" /><CodeLine lineNumber="466"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// lsrs r4, r4, #NrBitsToZero</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00901" /><CodeLine lineNumber="901"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Now push the high registers</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00902" /><CodeLine lineNumber="902"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// There are no store instructions that can access high registers directly,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00903" /><CodeLine lineNumber="903"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// so we have to move them to low registers, and push them.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00904" /><CodeLine lineNumber="904"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This might take multiple pushes, as it is possible for there to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00905" /><CodeLine lineNumber="905"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// be fewer low registers available than high registers which need saving.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00906" /><CodeLine lineNumber="906"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00907" /><CodeLine lineNumber="907"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Find the first register to save.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00908" /><CodeLine lineNumber="908"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Registers must be processed in reverse order so that in case we need to use</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00909" /><CodeLine lineNumber="909"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// multiple PUSH instructions, the order of the registers on the stack still</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00910" /><CodeLine lineNumber="910"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// matches the unwind info. They need to be swicthed back to ascending order</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00911" /><CodeLine lineNumber="911"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// before adding to the PUSH instruction.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1128"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Determine intermediate registers which can be used for pushing the frame</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1129"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// record:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1130"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - Unused argument registers</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1131"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - LR: This is possible because the first PUSH will save it on the stack,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1132"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//       so it is free to be used as a temporary for the second. However, it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1133"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//       is possible for LR to be live-in to the function, in which case we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1134"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//       will need to restore it later in the prologue, so we only use this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1135"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//       if there are no free argument registers.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1136"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::set&lt;Register&gt; FrameRecordCopyRegs;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1137"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ArgReg : &#123;ARM::R0, ARM::R1, ARM::R2, ARM::R3&#125;)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1138"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!MF.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction/#a810234b6b3d223b7c74a4253fcc5ea5e">getRegInfo</a>().<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineregisterinfo/#a640f34062e7189756ce67e60d5dfd629">isLiveIn</a>(ArgReg))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1139"><span class="doxyHighlight">      FrameRecordCopyRegs.insert(ArgReg);</span></CodeLine>
